attributes.action: Recognise  the CST volunteers who saved lives at the Manchester Synagogue
attributes.additional_details:
We have an honours system that rewards people for playing sport or being on television.
In this instance that system should be used to publicly acknowledge the bravery that stopped further deaths.
These rewards should extend to the police officers who approached a man that they believed had a bomb.
attributes.background: The death toll from the terrorist attack on a Synagogue yesterday would have been far higher if it had not been for the incredible bravery and selflessness of the volunteer security guards from the Community Security Trust. We want that bravery recognised & rewarded

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions that ask for people to be given honours.

The Government will only accept individual nominations, not petitions, so we can’t publish your petition.

To submit a nomination for an honour, visit: http://www.gov.uk/honours/
